intro: Rondeletia americana, commonly known as the American rondeletia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 feet. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The flowers are showy, with five petals and a yellow center, often blooming in clusters during the spring and summer months.
